Hmmm. I like this idea!

However, perhaps instead of actually spawning a chest where they are on death like they could simply drop wood planks in addition to standard loot based on the location. That way it's as though you had you break it apart to defeat it.

It would be cool if it started attacking you only once you try to open it, and also was stealing an item you were holding when opening it.

If you'd careless and opened it with sword in you hand, you would have a problem with killing it.
As a old D&D player I would love to see mimics in the game - adds a risk/reward element for exploring

Addition along with mimics - baby mimics. These exist in Dungeons and Dragons, and are more likely to be friendly to the players. My interpretation of this for Minecraft is that you can actually tame a baby mimic! Then you can use it as a chest that can follow you around while you're doing stuff. 

Yes this would, like shulker boxes, increase the amount of items you can collect and take along with you. It would be easier to obtain, and could be obtained earlier in the game. However, it wouldn't entirely replace shulker boxes, because like any pet, you have to worry about the mimic's safety. If the mimic dies, it drops everything in its inventory, and if you can't fit it all in your inventory, then you have some tough choices to make regarding what items you keep and what items you have to leave behind. Therefor, shulker boxes wouldn't be rendered obsolete, because Mimics would require maintenance and care to keep them from dying and dropping all your stuff, whereas shulker boxes just can sit in your inventory and hold stuff, and are much less risky to use.

T.L.D.R - Adding mimics in the game, include baby mimics that are able to be tamed and used as extra portable inventory space. This would not make shulker boxes obsolete, because mimics can die and drop your stuff, and you might have to leave stuff behind.
I'd love to see this as well! Imagine being in the mountain biome and finding a cave, only to find out there are bears inside! Brown Bears and black bears, and even Grizzlies! I love it.
Real animals as hostile mobs will be rejected by mojang, turn them into neutral mobs!
Grizzlies and Brown Bears are two different kinds of bears. Grizzlies are more dangerous than Brown Bears, and look slightly different.

Why would you prevent aging? If you kill a mobâ€™s baby, it drops nothing except maybe a exp. point. Adults are the ones that drop meat, leather, feathers, eggs, fish, plants, etc. What is the point of preventing aging? Adults are the most helpful.

Maybe it should be based off of a mechanic already in the game, like how if you put a nametag the mob won't despawn, so why not tweak it so the mob won't change at all when given a nametag, or their data is static after being given a name.  I feel like baby animals could be extremely useful when considering hitboxes and how they affect certain farms, to respond to Claire Hartman.  Plus, aethetics of having a perpetual baby in your base like a puppy or something.

I agree with FantzeyMan, as "Grumm" or "Dinnerbone" flips models upside-down, having a name to keep them permanently small seems like a fairly simple solution (maybe not coding-wise, but design-wise).

You might want to explain why a mob that breaks blocks would be good in the game and what it would otherwise be like.  Is it hostile or passive?  Which blocks can it break?  Because all I can think is another mob that people are going to find a pain in the rear because it breaks stuff, like endermen and creepers and ghasts.

Yes, a miner, not a griefing mob

A Villager that mines blocks just like the farmer farms!

And one that places blocks!

Wither can already chew through most blocks that touches it. This is already a feature and it can be used for mining, automatic cobblestone/wood farms, etc. Many people, however, seem to not use this feature.
Zombies can break wooden doors.  Withers can break anything.  Endermen can manipulate blocks.  Enderdragons can destroy non-end blocks.  Undead mobs trample turtle eggs.  What else do we need?
Oh, and creepers can send entire houses into oblivion.  I almost forgot.
This is a cool idea, I like it, but if it were too common, it would make the game way way way harder.
This definitely would be a good idea...if it had more info.

1.15 you mean it wont happen in 1.14 because the Update is coming to a finish and nothing exiting is going to be added Also the wither breaks things too and the Ender dragon so yeah maybe a boss or a mini boss could break things I do not know but nice idea though. :)

This would be a great idea far underground. Currently if you are really good at placing blocks it isn't all that difficult to avoid mobs while mining at Y level 11. If you add a monster like this it creates a challenge in a place where there should be a challenge.

What if Mojang added this functionality to zombies? They'd break blocks at the same speed as a hand, except if they have a tool that's effective against that block. Also, zombies should be able to place a limited amount of dirt to chase after someone, about 16 blocks. This would make fighting zombies much more interesting.

California Sea Otters and other otter breeds are such an important animal to the ocean ecosystem. They are in-fact highly endangered, and once thought to be extinct due to over-hunting. They are not only a predator but are also highly adorable. Sea Otters eat the sea urchins and control their numbers, as sea urchins devour the root systems of the magnificent kelp forests. They can lay waste to the magnificent kelp forests, but sea otters keep them in check by eating them. There are only about 3,000 southern sea otters alive today.

I think it can be such a useful mob to be added to the game and bring awareness to this necessary animal.

I love that you included space/room as a requirement for taming.
So many of the passive/friendly mobs in this game get shoved into 1*1 wide holes to farm for resources, simply because the game mechanics make it the most efficient way. This idea directly challenges that.
And also is very cute, which is a bonus :D

I think it would be great if sea otters would spawn more commonly near kelp seeing as they eat kelp. Maybe otters could harvest kelp for you?  The river otter would fish for you and the sea otter would harvest kelp for you.
Awe I love this! They should also eat kelp :)
I would love to just have it as a pet already! WAIT... BUCKET OF OTTER?!
I want this so bad

This is a great idea! I love the concept, and it would be very in character for Minecraft to add an endangered animal to the game (example: axolotls). If killed, it would also be cool if they dropped a special stone. All otters have a stone special to them which they use to open clams/shells in real life. In game, it would be cool if they dropped a special stone that allows you to have some sort of effect while holding it, such as dolphins grace, depth strider, or water breathing. (Or there could be different types, similar to pottery shards.

Snails should be able to be picked up by the player and placed somewhere else. If one is placed adjacent to a leaf block, it should be able to turn it into fertilizer particles over a period of 300-400 ticks. Fertilizer essence could be used to craft bonemeal. Perhaps snails could use slime as breeding material, which would encourage exploring since they would be found in dark oak biomes and their breeding material is primary gained in swamps. If a snail is killed, it should drop a snail shell. Snails could come in variants, all with unique shells.
Defently
They should also be small, like the size of baby bees. The could also leave a trail of slime behind them. If you use a shovel on the trail, you can get slimeballs.

I full heartedly agree with the idea of snails. I also agree with the other ideas in this comment section. Definitely have diversity in the snails. The snails can be found in certain biomes such as the swamp and dark forest. While I think that the majority of snails should be small it would be cool if there was a small chance of a large snail (about the size of an adult bee) spawning that you could either take home with you and keep or harvest it for a load of slime balls and a special shell for other properties.

I thought I was opening up the idea to discussion so others can participate. I would think the drop would be a great segue into another idea. Perhaps some new light source block, or a light source for your helmet. The mob is unique that there could be many ideas for what the drop could do. I would love to hear what others say.

If this post doesnâ€™t get much traction then thatâ€™s fine. Thatâ€™s the name of the game. But I still want to be supportive of anyone who wants to add to the idea.  If I wrote the post wrong Iâ€™m sorry.
If you switch the language to Shakespearean English blazes are called will-o-the-wisps.
**Sims has just entered the chat**

What if they have a 50-50 chance of leading you to some kind of cool loot/thing to aid you with a boss (like in Brave) vs. leading you to your death (like in the actual folklore). Maybe they can spawn in a light yellow but if you drink a specific potion or maybe offer it something like an orchid it will glow red or green to tell you if it will hurt or harm you.

Will-o-wisps are also called fox-fires so really, they can look like glowing fox spirits too. Not just a floating ball. Either one would be very cool.
Do you mind if I use this idea in one of my posts? Changing it a little bit.

My idea for wisps:

Spawning in swamp biomes, WOTWs would look like blue shulker pellets, and be randomly hostile. While the WOTWs hover around their spawn locations, approaching them will cause them to either attack, unleashing massive fire damage, or activate their enchanting powers. If the WOTWs choose to aid you, a held enchanted item will gain a random enchantment, while an enchanted item will lose all enchantments. If you arenâ€™t holding an enchantable item, then the WOTWs will always attack.
They exist in minecraft already. They are called blazes

It should be a no-drop and no-damage mob, but it would lead the player at night.
They would only appear in the dark and disappear by the light (torch or sun) so the player would not be able to light the road, but by undermining Will-o'-Wisp, the player could either:
- reach the witch's house
- reach a sudden drop in terrain (e.g. a canyon)
- find a boat with a chest (swamp update)
- fall into a deep pit of liquid mud, in which it is difficult to swim and the air escapes faster (Minecraft Earth)

The phenomena of the will-o'-the-wisp are caused by the oxidation of phosphine and methane. The phosphine and methane come from the chemical breakdown of dead plants and animals in wet areas, so I think the source block should be something like a rotten log, that wil create these ghost light particles on the surface if you place it underwater.

Phantoms spawning trigger seems more fitting for The End, anyway. 

Players can spend extended periods in the end without sleeping since there isn't' a Day/Night cycle. Hopping from one City to the next, or AFK'ing at an Endermen farm, should come with risks. 

Phantoms would also pose a significantly higher threat in the End, knocking players on the edge of an island into the Void.

Most players I know who roam in the overworld carry a bed to skip the night anyway. Phantoms rarely have the ability to spawn at all.

Not to mention considering how hard they are to kill for a fairly new player (who will most likely be the only ones encountering them unintentionally), compared to how useless their drop is at that point in the game! The only 2 things it's used for is potions of slow falling (which tell me outside of elytra when has anybody ever used?) and to repair elytra which is quite literally an end game item!

maybe this could be apart of an end update? maybe they sometimes protect end cities or the ender dragon? or maybe there spawning is more balanced so they aren't annoying like they are now? and maybe the ender dragon can call for them? good post to.    :)

I don't think adding phantoms is a good idea. The idea of having to worry about not sleeping for phantoms to attack you, you looking up the end sky in worry whil still trying to avoid looking at Endermen and trying to do your planned task would be annoying, not fun, and unnecessary.
Yes! Or maybe a variation of the phantom that drops gunpowder!

It would be a fun challenge if they spawned especially around end ships to protect the elytras!

Some people think it would be too hard, butâ€¦ itâ€™s normal, itâ€™s supposed to be the End of the game! And highly valuable loot deserves some amount of difficulty.

But I understand that it could be very annoying, for example if you want to build when youâ€™ve already spent some time in this dimension. So I got an idea: why not adding an item, a new totem, that you would find in the End and that would repulse phantoms? I created a post for it here.

Great idea, I would love to see it implemented.

For those who are concerned about getting mobbed by phantoms, here is my balance suggestion: Make more phantoms spawn the further you get from a major island. No phantoms would spawn directly over major islands. This would make it so if you want to build long bridges you will fight more phantoms or you could play it safe and avoid (most of) the phantoms.

This would also make it much harder to 'skip' the dragon by building to the outer islands before killing the dragon for the first time. If you tried to 'skip' the dragon, you would get mobbed by tons of phantoms and most likely killed.

 

Note: If you have not tried flying with the phantoms, it is fun aaaannnnd a death sentence. I tried it... once.

Yes! I was going to submit this idea myself, and I found this post. This would totally fix the phantoms issue. It would also make the dragon fight a little harder, since you can't use Potions of Slow Falling (unless you bridge to the outer islands). Phantoms would fit in The End too, because they fly like the dragon, and because we know that phantom membranes are the material for elytra.

Um... the end is entirely floating islands. Most of the time you have to place blocks and make precarious bridges just to get anywhere. Having Phantoms in the End would be literal heck (Plus, what made Phantoms unique is that they are one of the few flying mobs specific to the overworld). As cool as it is in concept, in actuality it would be really really annoying. :/
It makes so much more sense when you think about Phantom membrane which is an item for REPARING ELYTRA should be located in the end where the Elytra actually is

This is a great idea but needs balancing.
It is a great idea because:
1) phantoms are annoying in the in the overworld and in the early game, but their threat can be completely negated when the sun rises.
2) phantoms provide phantom membrane, an item whose only functions are late game functions. Elytra/brewing stand. (Brewing stand is as early as it gets.)
3) they would fit well with the aesthetic of the end.
4) have you ever seen an enderman sleep before?

They would need balancing because
1) the primary threat of the end is the elder dragon, and having them around on the main island would be annoying. (Fix: keep them away from the main island. Perhaps make end crystals kill them, but prioritize healing the ender dragon, or simply make them unable to spawn)
2) bridging to other islands would be a challenge. They would force you to take precautions like building a railing when you bridge through the end. (Make it so they only spawn above solid ground. Maybe the ground above their spawn must be 3 blocks thick or something.)
3) phantoms only spawn after the player hasnâ€™t slept for a few nights. The way they spawn would have to change, and it would sacrifice the integrity of the phantomâ€™s lore, which Mojang is very protective over.

Overall I love this idea but it will need work.
Definitely like this idea, would make exploring the End more interesting and treacherous which it should be as endgame content. Elytra combat vs phantoms sounds cool.

I love this idea. The Phantom should be added to The End and removed from the overworld.
Another possibility to balance the Phantom would be if they came from nests that spawned in The End, rather than randomly appearing above you.

The old nether wasn't as safe as looking down and pressing f5 to remove all dangers.We have ghast fireballs, magma cubes, and in the newer updates, skeletons, piglins, and hoglins that keep you on edge for the most port of your nether journey. Phantoms spawning in the end would be the first step to an actually dangerous End, and it will nerf a lot of enderman farm designs as well.

Yes! I think they should be an end exclusive mob, that way you won't have to deal with the annoyance in the overworld and you have some actual challenge to get some of the best loot in the game.

At the moment the end cities are too easy to loot and get mass ammounts of diamond armour with little effort. Having a phantom chase you as you fly with an elytra would add extra the challenge that we need.

For the end, I thought about an alive version of the phantom, that use the model from the drawing, but would be called "ender ray". But it would be a passive mob, like an animal, that we could sometime see flying in the air. But leaving the end would turn them into phantom, like piglins and hoglin that become undeads if they leave the nether.

First of all, I don't necessarily disagree with you, Phantoms would be cool to have in the end. But not the way they are right now, and no the way the end is right now. People already complain about phantoms so much, Mojang literally added a setting that gets rid of them, something that has happened to no other mob in Minecraft! And that's with them being avoidable vie sleep. Now imagine that they were completely unavoidable in the nether.

I don't know if you play bedrock or Java, but I'm gonna compare end phantoms to ghasts in the nether. I play bedrock, and ghost are super annoying, I've heard that in Java you don't run into them a lot, but in bedrock their constant, there's always at least one ghast in sight, and sometimes two of them will spawn in the same spot and gang up on you! They're super annoying, and they're literally the biggest danger I face traversing the nether. Phantoms would probably have similar spawn rates (and probably more equally annoying across versions), they would be life threatening when bridging (some people say "Just pearl", but that's not always possible/easy/safe).

As of right now, end islands are vary safe, which makes sense because they have nothing of value on them. End cities are super challenging, but have great stuff. Phantoms would make end life harder, and I don't want the boring end to become even more annoying.

Not only would the glow squid improve the looks of underwater caves (as right now there are only axolotyls), it could be used to get glowing-related items that help the player with mining and/or "caving". For instance, perhaps the glow squid could drop "glow sticks" like in Terraria, or "glow ink", or whatever. If you harvested some of those rare crystals (because it needs to be somewhat difficult), you could combine them with the glow ink/sticks, and maybe glass as well, to make "glowing glasses"/"night vision glasses". Or, you could even combine the "glow ink" with a stick to make a "glow torch", that could not only provide the possibility of having torches underwater, but also be a way for the player to get torches without mining coal, in underwater caves where mining is difficult (streamlined caving is also something that needs to be addressed in this update, as caving can become a torch-management game very quickly). There are many other crafting possibilities with "glow ink" like "glowing books" or "glowing armor"; use your imagination to imagine all of the things that would be better when glowing (pretty much everything!).
